chunks.text: Welcome to mobile app development with Flutter. Flutter is Google's UI toolkit for building natively compiled applications.
Flutter uses Dart programming language and provides a rich set of pre-designed widgets following Material Design and Cupertino styles.
The widget tree is Flutter's core concept. Everything is a widget, from structural elements to styling and layout components.
Stateless widgets are immutable and don't change over time. Stateful widgets can rebuild when their internal state changes.
Hot reload feature allows instant visualization of changes without losing application state, speeding up development significantly.
Layout in Flutter uses widgets like Container, Row, Column, Stack, and Flex to arrange UI elements on screen.
Navigation between screens uses Navigator and routes. You can push and pop routes to manage the navigation stack.
State management options include setState, Provider, Riverpod, BLoC pattern, and GetX, each with different complexity levels.
Flutter supports platform-specific code through platform channels, allowing integration with native iOS and Android features.
Animations in Flutter can be implicit or explicit. AnimationController and Tween classes create custom animations.
Testing includes unit tests, widget tests, and integration tests. Flutter provides a comprehensive testing framework.
Publishing apps requires building release versions and following platform-specific guidelines for App Store and Google Play.
Flutter's single codebase for multiple platforms makes it efficient for cross-platform development. Keep learning and building!
